intro: Centaurea soskae subsp. aetiensis, commonly known as the Aetolian centaurea, is a flowering plant native to the Aegean region of Greece. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in open habitats such as coastal cliffs and dry meadows. It is a perennial species that produces small, bract-like leaves and has a compact growth habit. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
